rows.title: How to remove the space between inline/inline-block elements?

84:
<p>For CSS3 conforming browsers there is <code>white-space-collapsing:discard</code> </p>

<p>see: <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/2010/WD-css3-text-20101005/#white-space-collapsing" rel="noreferrer">http://www.w3.org/TR/2010/WD-css3-text-20101005/#white-space-collapsing</a></p>

<p>I had this problem right now and from <code>font-size:0;</code> I've found that in Internet&nbsp;Explorer&nbsp;7 the problem remains because Internet&nbsp;Explorer thinks "Font Size 0?!?! WTF are you crazy man?" - So, in my case I've Eric Meyer's CSS reset and with <code>font-size:0.01em;</code> I have a difference of 1 pixel from Internet&nbsp;Explorer&nbsp;7 to Firefox&nbsp;9, so, I think this can be a solution.</p>

<p>I'm going to expand on user5609829's answer a little bit as I believe the other solutions here are too complicated/too much work.  Applying a <code>margin-right: -4px</code> to the inline block elements will remove the spacing and is supported by all browsers.  See the updated fiddle <a href="http://jsfiddle.net/dGHFV/2292/" rel="nofollow">here</a>.  For those concerned with using negative margins, try giving <a href="https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2009/07/the-definitive-guide-to-using-negative-margins/" rel="nofollow">this</a> a read. </p>
